intro: Lucuma sclerocarpa, commonly known as the golden fruit or lucuma, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, sweet, and aromatic fruit that resembles a small, yellowish orange. The fruit develops from an inflorescence called a cyme, which consists of multiple small, fleshy berries. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Its botanical features make it both a valuable food source and an ornamental plant in its native habitat.
